data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3028714,"name":"Joshua Epperson","username":"jepperson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/74df32/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-23T14:56:15.446Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eCurrently, I generate a separate path for each “part” in my auto and have the ramsete command perform it, then pack that action into a command and have the collection of all the paths be run in sequence, with other commands being run in between. Now I know I could just have one trajectory and use parallel wait commands but the thing is I like how it is now because it allows you to change stuff on the fly. My only issue is that it creates a lot of clutter in our codebase and I notice these .path files, was wondering if I could take advantage of those as I’m able to create checkpoints in PathPlanner. Are those the poses?
